medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially identified during a routine office visit, further testing after a 12-hour fast showed consistent elevated lipid levels. The patient has attempted to follow a low-fat diet for several months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, initially discovered during pregnancy and currently treated with hydrochlorothiazide (25 mg daily), and history of one pregnancy complicated by hypertension and preeclampsia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of breast cancer at age 49; maternal grandmother diagnosed with breast cancer at age 50; brother had a stroke in his 30s and is on therapy for elevated LDL cholesterol.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with a 3-year-old child, works in transportation. Former smoker with a 35 pack-year history but quit several years ago. Does not drink alcohol to excess or use recreational drugs; has improved diet but does not exercise regularly.
